name: Unlimited Tags
description: This is a ture desparado runner , never clear tags. and force the corp to trash your resources and clear virus. Some ICE like Data Raven can't stop this deck, and with Masanori and desoerado you can get cards and credits.

name: Whizzard_V1.1
description: This is my attempt to a Whizzard deck. Feedback welcome.

name: Excessive Expenses
description: Idea is to take control of the Corp ICE and funds so you could just walk in and take what you want.

name: Excessive Expenses v1.2
description: Idea is to take control of the Corp ICE and funds so you could just walk in and take what you want. This is an updated version of the list

name: Weyland 1.1
All Your Base Is
description: Updated. This deck is mean't to wholly ignore the remotes and hammer the centrals over and over as much as possible early on. Everything is meant to maximize the number if runs you get, gathering credits while they do it, and to increase the value of those runs with the fourth click.

name: Express Access
description: More thoughts using central only breakers.

name: Jinteki burn
description: Basic jinteki deck, you attack the runners deck, so they spend clicks recovering giving you turns to score ajendas. Some times also forcing them to make mistakes.

name: Big Breakers, Poor Corp
description:
First run through the deck: TestRun/Scavenge out your primo breaker suite and start amassing some cash. Early siphons or indexings if you can. Try to get one of the 2 MU breakers on Dino (note: if its already out you can use scavenge to get it onto a fresh Dino).

2nd pass through the deck: Keep running, mostly R&D and HQ. Recur indexing and siphon as needed. Use imp (and recur it with test run/scavenge) to clear out assets or dead cards in HQ. Use Crescentus (and recur it with test run) to force the corp to keep spending money on their big ice (which you will need to break by just shelling out the cash).

name: Caissia R&D Attack/Blackguard
HB Drain Bramage
Kit ICE destruction v4
Reina Ice Denial
Grndl bug 2.0
Noise - Gourmet Runner
description:
The main idea : Selective milling from R&D thanks to Deep Thought. Once an agenda is seen, either a R&D run or an Archive run should do the trick, provided you have a virus in hand (but this should not prove too difficult).

Scavenge is nice with imp, to reset its counter or get a knight back with a discount.

Hemorrhage and nerve agent form a plan B to pressure the corp's hand in case R&D and Archive are both strongly protected.

name: Tango Spotted v 3.0
description: This deck likes to hurt the runner for trying to score agendas and scoring agendas. Play testing resulted in getting plenty of cash to win those traces, so the runner gets tag. Then hurt the runner with impunity. Favorite death to a runner so far with this deck was runner scored a 2 pt. agenda, has 4 credit left, 3 cards for his Grip and 2 tags (end turn). I hit him with Scorched Earth, which completely absorbed by his Plascrete Carapace and then I finish him off with a second Scorched Earth to win the game.

name: The Queen of Trashing
description:
This is the deck I made and have been playing against my friend for awhile now with excellent success, more than any other deck I've built before. It's on it's third version now. I just added Hemorrhage, and while I've to see how it works in this deck, I imagine it will do well and it can be tutored with djinn. I have only one core set or I might have three djinns.

Get Rook on ice early and drain the corp. Use Crescentus to derez big ice and drain the corp to re-rez for +3 credits. Knight is amazing but use Djinn to get crypsis out early so you can safely facecheck ice and keep the corp poor.

Keep a lot of pressure on R&D by recurring parasites and locking the ice down with Knight. It's quick and easy to target a remote with knights and cyrpsis. Mimic for swordsman.

The idea behind the economy is to have minimal clicks for credits so you can use your clicks on caissa programs or other actions. Kati is the only click intensive resource since Professional contacts rewards you for what you should be doing anyway.

I'd love some feedback and more playtesting! Thanks!

name: Back to Basics
description: A somewhat-janky HB deck that focuses on install synergies and flexibility.

name: NBN Special Report v2.0
Doran's Blade No#2
description: The concept of this deck is "Pumping ice & Trash" how do u guys think?
